summary: This bill, the Finger Lakes National Heritage Area Act, amends the John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act. It designates the Finger Lakes National Heritage Area in New York State, encompassing 14 counties. The Finger Lakes Tourism Alliance will serve as the local coordinating entity. The bill mandates a management plan to be submitted to the Secretary of the Interior within three years of enactment and sets a 15-year limit on federal assistance for the area.
